meanings.definition: A medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.
meanings.sent1: I used my money to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent2: She saved up enough money to go on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The money in my piggy bank is happy to be spent.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a river of money flowing freely.
meanings.sent5: The shiny coins and crumpled banknotes made up his money.

meanings.definition: Wealth in the form of assets or property.
meanings.sent1: His money allowed him to buy a big house.
meanings.sent2: The family's money came from generations of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The money in the treasure chest was guarded by a dragon.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a treasure chest full of money for those in need.
meanings.sent5: The golden key unlocked a room filled with money and jewels.

meanings.sent1: I gave the cashier my money for the groceries.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic asked for the money after fixing the car.
meanings.sent3: The money danced out of my wallet and into the donation box.
meanings.sent4: His hard work was rewarded with a bag full of money.
meanings.sent5: The money exchanged hands quickly at the bustling market.
